rename.from: typeIs behavior has changed since helm 3.18.0
rename.to: typeIs/typeOf behavior has changed since helm 3.18.0

issue.title: Possibly found a major bug in the new 3.18.0 version
issue.body:
Since the new 3.18.0 version was release we see in our deployment pipeline the error

~~~
Error: UPGRADE FAILED: cannot patch "xxx-ingress-nginx-controller" with kind Deployment: Deployment.apps "xxx-ingress-nginx-controller" is invalid: spec.progressDeadlineSeconds: Invalid value: 0: must be greater than minReadySeconds
~~~

The relevant template code that is producing the nginx-controller deployment is
~~~
  {{- if .Values.controller.progressDeadlineSeconds }}
  progressDeadlineSeconds: {{ .Values.controller.progressDeadlineSeconds }}
  {{- end }}
~~~
and the default value for `progressDeadlineSeconds` in the values is `0`.

Also nothing else changed in our envionment. Below you find the rendered manifest from yesterday and also from today with the new helm version.

yesterday
~~~
# Source: xxx/charts/ingress-nginx/templates/controller-deployment.yaml
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    helm.sh/chart: ingress-nginx-4.12.1
    app.kubernetes.io/name: ingress-nginx
    app.kubernetes.io/instance: xxx
    app.kubernetes.io/version: "1.12.1"
    app.kubernetes.io/part-of: ingress-nginx
    app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: Helm
    app.kubernetes.io/component: controller
  name: xxx-ingress-nginx-controller
  namespace: xxx
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app.kubernetes.io/name: ingress-nginx
      app.kubernetes.io/instance: xxx
      app.kubernetes.io/component: controller
  replicas: 1
  revisionHistoryLimit: 10
  minReadySeconds: 0
  template:
    metadata:
...
~~~

today
~~~
# Source: xxx/charts/ingress-nginx/templates/controller-deployment.yaml
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    helm.sh/chart: ingress-nginx-4.12.1
    app.kubernetes.io/name: ingress-nginx
    app.kubernetes.io/instance: xxx
    app.kubernetes.io/version: "1.12.1"
    app.kubernetes.io/part-of: ingress-nginx
    app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: Helm
    app.kubernetes.io/component: controller
  name: xxx-ingress-nginx-controller
  namespace: xxx
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app.kubernetes.io/name: ingress-nginx
      app.kubernetes.io/instance: xxx
      app.kubernetes.io/component: controller
  replicas: 1
  revisionHistoryLimit: 10
  progressDeadlineSeconds: 0    <------
  minReadySeconds: 0
  template:
    metadata:
...
~~~

Notice that `progressDeadlineSeconds` was rendered in with the value `0`.

So I assume that somehow the evaulation of ints in an if expression changed, from assuming `0` equals to `false` and anything else to `true` (like in C), to everything valid int value (including `0`) equals to `true`.

I assume that because I do not see anyother way how the template above would result in the result I see.

I would also consider this a major bug, since if my assumption is true this would mean a major change in how templates are evaluated and could lead to many unwanted results.

PS: we rolledback the helm version to 3.17.3 and our deployments are running without issue.

body: I think this is an effect of #13534

Observed the same behavior with other charts too - for example - Gitea.

Downgrading helm to 3.17.x solves the issue
This is from #13534 and appears to be a regression impacting things beyond toml. Unfortunately, this was looked at by 3 maintainers and we missed this.
Note, I'm adding this to the dev meeting discussion topics so we can discuss the broader handling of this situation.

issue.title: Reverting fix "renders int as float"

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

issue.body:
This reverts #13533

This change has caused issues with numerous charts around things unrelated to toml. This is because of functions like typeIs/typeOf being used and acted upon.

The change caused a significant regression.

Note: This kind of change can be put into v3 charts, that are in active development, without causing a regression.

Closes #30880

<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. Make sure to read the Contributing Guide before submitting your PR: https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
2. If this PR closes another issue, add 'closes #<issue number>' somewhere in the PR summary. GitHub will automatically close that issue when this PR gets merged. Alternatively, adding 'refs #<issue number>' will not close the issue, but help provide the reviewer more context.-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**: There is regression caused by #13533 and its backport.

**Special notes for your reviewer**: This change can later be folded into the next generation of charts safely.

**If applicable**:
- [ ] this PR contains user facing changes (the `docs needed` label should be applied if so)
- [ ] this PR contains unit tests
- [ ] this PR has been tested for backwards compatibility

body:
PRs have been opened for a potential fix. These will be discussed on Thursday. I would like to get fixes out before the next normal patch release because of the regression but there was a set of regressions this time and it will likely wait on those. I'll know more after the Thursday meeting.

We are on it. Please stay tuned.

issue.title: `helmfile init` does not work with `helm` 3.18.0

repository.name: helmfile
repository.description: Declaratively deploy your Kubernetes manifests, Kustomize configs, and Charts as Helm releases. Generate all-in-one manifests for use with ArgoCD.

issue.body:
### Helmfile Version

main

### Helm Version

3.18.0

### Bug description

The `helm-secrets` version 4.6.3 installed by `helmfile init` does not work with `helm` 3.18.0. This has been fixed in `helm-secrets` version [4.6.5](https://github.com/jkroepke/helm-secrets/blob/v4.6.5/CHANGELOG.md#465---2025-05-20).

https://github.com/helmfile/helmfile/blob/main/pkg/app/init.go#L23

### Error message you've seen (if any)

```raw
Install helm plugin secrets
panic: BUG: please file an github issue for this unhandled error: helmexec.ExitError: command "/usr/bin/helm" exited with non-zero status:
	
	PATH:
	  /usr/bin/helm
	
	ARGS:
	  0: helm (4 bytes)
	  1: plugin (6 bytes)
	  2: install (7 bytes)
	  3: https://github.com/jkroepke/helm-secrets (40 bytes)
	  4: --version (9 bytes)
	  5: v4.6.3 (6 bytes)
	
	ERROR:
	  exit status 1
	
	EXIT STATUS
	  1
	
	STDERR:
	  Error: plugin is installed but unusable: both platformCommand and command are set in "/root/.local/share/helm/plugins/helm-secrets/plugin.yaml"
	
	COMBINED OUTPUT:
	  Error: plugin is installed but unusable: both platformCommand and command are set in "/root/.local/share/helm/plugins/helm-secrets/plugin.yaml"
```

body:
I'm guessing that due to the type change also "emptiness" is evaluated differently?

It seems like values assigned 0 are also seen as non-empty now with helm 3.18.0, e.g.:
GitHub Actions Run: https://github.com/accelleran/helm-charts/actions/runs/15154708025/job/42607187094#step:12:40
Template: https://github.com/accelleran/helm-charts/blob/627a35f02ecf6f6e942ed4885cdd17a1763c546f/charts/common/templates/_pdb.tpl#L12
Values:
```
pdb:
  create: true
  minAvailable: 0
  maxUnavailable: 0
```

issue.title: ci: Add test case for issue 30880

labels.name: size/XS
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 0-9 lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
Proposing a testcase for https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/30880

Here we add a test on `typeOf` that can be used in helm templates, so we validate there is no change in the behavior.

## In details (issue)

With helm 3.18.0, we had a change in `typeIs`/`typeOf` gotemplate behavior.

For example in:
https://github.com/oauth2-proxy/manifests/blob/4001c2385dc72990add71437b02e18d7ec7f8ffd/helm/oauth2-proxy/templates/_ingress.tpl#L40-L44

While debugging, we saw that `typeOf .servicePort` has changed from `float64` to `json.Number`.

This could be a bad practice from the chart (that should probably use `KindIs`), but this is widely used and could break many charts.

Step to reproduce:

Helm 3.17.3:
```sh
$ helm repo add oauth2-proxy https://oauth2-proxy.github.io/manifests
"oauth2-proxy" has been added to your repositories

$ helm version
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.17.3", GitCommit:"e4da49785aa6e6ee2b86efd5dd9e43400318262b", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.23.7"}

$ cat <<EOF | helm template demo oauth2-proxy/oauth2-proxy -f -
{
  "ingress": {
    "enabled": true,
    "hosts": ["demo.fr"]
  }
}
EOF
[...]
# Source: oauth2-proxy/templates/ingress.yaml
[...]
spec:
  rules:
    - host: "demo.fr"
      http:
        paths:
          - path: /
            pathType: ImplementationSpecific
            backend:
              service:
                name: demo-oauth2-proxy
                port:
                  number: 80                                         <==== OK
```

Helm 3.18.0:
```sh
$ helm version
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.18.0", GitCommit:"cc58e3f5a3aa615c6a86275e6f4444b5fdd3cc4e", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.24.3"}

$ cat <<EOF | helm template demo oauth2-proxy/oauth2-proxy -f -
{
  "ingress": {
    "enabled": true,
    "hosts": ["demo.fr"]
  }
}
EOF
[...]
# Source: oauth2-proxy/templates/ingress.yaml
[...]
spec:
  rules:
    - host: "demo.fr"
      http:
        paths:
          - path: /
            pathType: ImplementationSpecific
            backend:
              service:
                name: demo-oauth2-proxy
                port:                                            <======= missing
```

<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. Make sure to read the Contributing Guide before submitting your PR: https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
2. If this PR closes another issue, add 'closes #<issue number>' somewhere in the PR summary. GitHub will automatically close that issue when this PR gets merged. Alternatively, adding 'refs #<issue number>' will not close the issue, but help provide the reviewer more context.-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

**If applicable**:
- [ ] this PR contains user facing changes (the `docs needed` label should be applied if so)
- [ ] this PR contains unit tests
- [ ] this PR has been tested for backwards compatibility

body:
> This is from [#13534](https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/13534) and appears to be a regression impacting things beyond toml. Unfortunately, this was looked at by 3 maintainers and we missed this.

No worry, it has been quickly detected, all of you have found quickly the PR that introduced the issue and you already opened the revert PR https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/30885/files
I add a small contribution with a test case: https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/30888 (my PR is probably light years to be the right way to add it, I let you decide).

Thanks you all .
